title: fix(core): remove placeholderHandler for native node
body:
Introduced by #49 

Placeholder handlers for NativeNode are not properly removed when adding support for NativeNode as placeholder.

title: Expand effective range of changePropListener
body:
1. let property change listener takes effect on all "property-like" attributes, like `class`, `style`, `id`, `slot` or non-property attributes on NativeNode
2. call property change listener with `this` set to `null`, and related component set to owner host
3. initialize a property change listener with `undefined` as first old value
4. change methods for procGen in `ProcGenWrapper` to arrow function, to avoid `this` missing in template calls

title: feat: support dataset on slot node
Add style editable support in DOM backend for devtools
fix(template-compiler): made new template compile result compatible with old core
feat(core): expose dispatchError
body: Expose `dispatchError` for adapter to wrap codes easier, since this can now be done by an ugly `safeCallback(() => { throw new Error('message') })`.

title: fix: template literal update path tree calculation (#141)
feat(core): improve event listener filter to extend its usage
body:
Improved `eventListenerFilter` can handle usage of former `eventObjectFilter` and `eventListenerFilter`, while having more usage like dropping an specific event or handle event with knowledge of `generalLvaluePath`.

Some logic are also moved out from event listener (to binding-time), this may slightly improve event handling performance.

title: fix(miniprogram-adapter): chaining filter should work on the adapter chain
fix: allow legacy event binding syntax in slot nodes
body: This also fixes #188 .

title: feat: change destroy on removal strategy (#186)
feat: new host style support based on style scope
body:
Changed to use style scope as the `:host` compilation result, i.e. `:host` converted to `[wx-host="STYLE_SCOPE"]` where the `STYLE_SCOPE` is the style scope name of the component.

This makes the implementation of composed backends easier.

However, shared style scope will result in shared `:host` styles. To avoid this problem, `ComponentSpace#setSharedStyleScope` is introduced. If the `options.styleScope` of the component matches this "shared" style scope, the `wx-host` attribute will not be applied, in other words, the `:host` of the component will not take effect.

title: feat(template-compiler): allow removing template/script
feat: new API for inspector
fix: `:host` style warnings
Adapter: write init method to method caller
feat: support `:host` conversion
fix(template-compiler): end tag handling (#173)
body:
* Fix #173 by better end tag handling.
* Provide a more complete fix for #162 .

title: Update devtools related interface
Refactor property value and default function resolution
body:
Changes:
1. `property.value` will only be used for determining the initial value of a property
2. ensure that initial data and property values will never be `undefined` when calling `property.default` throws an error

Breaking change: when determining initial value of a property, if `property.default` throws an error, `property.value` will be used in current implementation; now a fallback value will be used, which means `property.value` will be completely ignored when `property.default` is a function.

Fix template ops
body: This implements #166 and #167

Avoid throwing error when importing file not found
Allow dynamic add observer

Add the following methds for component:
1. `dynamicAddObserver`
2. `addLifetimeListener`
3. `addPageLifetimeListener`

title: fix: generates true value for unspecified property value
Data update method callbacks wrapper
body: Callbacks for data update methods should be called with `ComponentCaller` as `this`, and should be wrapped with a `safeCallback`

Also change `TemplateParseError` to camelCase to better fit in JavaScript

Add extraThisFieldsType to enhance type completeness of ComponentInstance, which makes custom properties and methods type safe on "this"

body: By specifying workspace versions, `pnpm run --recursive` will be able to read package dependencies inside workspace and run `build` script topologically

title: Refactor template parser

This implements #132 and #24 , and contains low level support for #35 and #60 .

The new template parser has basic source location collection, which can be used to implement sourcemap.

Throw error when wx:elif / wx:else is unmatched

```html
// wxml
<div wx:elif="{{true}}" />
```

```
// output
Template parsing error (at :1:13): wx:elif has no adjacent wx:if
```

body: Sometimes the imported names are not ready when codegen for a single tree. This change allows it.

title: Always call `createComponent` from wrapper `createCommonElement`
body:
1. remove `placeholding` judgement from wrapper, since logics in `createComponent` is quite the same as `checkComponentPlaceholder`
2. always call `createComponent` (but not `createComponentOrNativeNode`) from wrapper `createCommonElement` as a result of _1_
3. rename `placeholderHandler` in `Element` to `placeholderHandlerRemover`, to improve readability
4. add `allowUnusedNativeNode` option to `ComponentSpace`, to allow unused tag name created as a `NativeNode`

title: Fix parsing unary expression
body:
+ Throw syntax error on non-left-handed expression such as `++1` or `----1`
+ Support `typeof` and `void` operator

title: refactor(adapter): take `space.ts` apart
body: Split `space.ts` into separate files since it was too large. No actual logic has been changed.

title: Diff class list before applying to backend
body:
![benchmark](https://github.com/wechat-miniprogram/glass-easel/assets/10173739/9a910197-cdec-43c8-8065-a955e8c210a5)
Left is glass-easel@0.2.1, right is code from this PR.
Benchmark: https://jsbench.me/5xlnwwr10a/1

Major changes:
+ Diff the class list before applying to backend
+ Use `/\s+/` to split raw class string with whitespaces
+ Drop hash map & use array to store class names

title: fallback event listener on NativeNode
body:
1. Add `fallbackListenerOnNativeNode`  option to fallback `bindxxx` legacy event binding syntax on native nodes.
2. Remove `disallowNativeNode` option (use `setGlobalUsingComponent` api).
3. Change `ProcGenWrapper#r` to an arrow function for `this` expression compatibility.
4. Remove `R.r` generation in template compiler. **WARNING: This is a forward compatibility hazard**

+ export existed method `TmplGroup.getScriptDependencies(): string[]`

title: Use rollup
body:
1. Use rollup to build glass-easel
2. Building result will be one single file (no `dist/types/` folder)
3. Add es-module format building result (with `import` `export`)
4. **Building result will target to ES6**
5. Upgrade typescript to 5.2.2
6. Fix some linting issue (caused by upgrade typescript and eslint-typescript parser)

title: Modify backend protocol for event-listener & context
body:
1. add `setDataset` for shadow backend
2. add `setListenerStats` replacing `setEventDefaultPrevented`
3. add `getContext` for elements with interactive context such as `<canvas />`
4. `FinalChanged` now representing the final state itself instead of state transitioning

title: fix(core): destroy backend element earilier
body:
When a data update applies in `detached` lifetime, current implementation destroys children's backend elements before parent's element, which leads to backend call like `backendParent.spliceRemove(null, 1)`, and may cause unexpected results in backend.

This Pull Request destroys parent's backend element first, to prevent cases like this.

body: The array returned by the function "convert_str_arr" contains "holes".  Fix: Change "push" to "set".

title: fix(template-compiler): remove debug log
fix: listener change lifetime typing mismatch (#50)
chore: import type testing assertions from `'tsd-lite'` package
body:
Hi, I am maintaining of the `'tsd-lite'` package, which you are using for testing types (via [`'jest-runner-tsd'`](https://github.com/jest-community/jest-runner-tsd)).

Just noticed that you are importing the type tests assertions from `'tsd'`. It would be better to import from `'tsd-lite'`, because the assertions differ between the packages. (They are less buggy and more predictable in `'tsd-lite'`.)

This is the only change I made. (By the way, notice how many useless dependencies got removed.)

The upcoming release of `'tsd-lite'` will disallow importing from `'tsd'`. So this is a quick maintenance PR to help you upgrade smoother.

feat(template-compiler): add set_inline_script and export_all_scripts
body:
Several changes are included in this PR:
1. add `TmplTree::set_inline_script` and `TmplGroup::set_inline_script` to allow overwriting inline scripts externally with wrapped or compiled version of script
2. (`TmplGroup`) changed return type of `get_inline_script` from `Result<Option<&str>, TmplError>` to `Result<&str, TmplError>`, and turn `Ok(None())` into an `TmplError`
3. (`TmplGroup`) extract codes from `write_group_global_content` to implement `write_all_scripts`, and add `export_all_scripts`, for exporting all scripts and process them in a different way with procGens
4. (`TmplGroup`) add `export_globals` to export all global runtime requirements, this can help to prevent repeating them in different target code chunks
5. add new and missing interfaces for C binding and JS binding
6. (JS binding) drop `mut` from `self` in `get_tmpl_gen_object`, `get_tmpl_gen_object_groups`, `get_wx_gen_object_groups`, since they seems do not need to be mutable
7. (C binding) update header with `cbindgen`

title: fix(core): cannot get component method defined from init
body: If a component method is defined and returned in `init` function, it cannot be found in the component even if `writeFieldsToNode` option is enabled, and the `Component.getMethod` does not returns it. This PR fix this problem.
